country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Before that, China was a confederation of states, called "the middle kingdoms".
sentences.chinese: 统一之前，中国是诸侯国的邦联，叫做“中央王国”。

sentences.english: Small kingdom built huge walls aiming at protecting their territories.
sentences.chinese: 诸侯国修起城墙，借以保护他们的领土。

sentences.english: So the territory of Shang should include these states into it.
sentences.chinese: 商代国家疆域应包括这些诸侯国在内。

sentences.english: Diplomacy had much function in each development process of various states.
sentences.chinese: 邦交在各诸侯国的发展过程中起着非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: Ducal states at that time built walls to defend their own territories.
sentences.chinese: 当时的各个诸侯国为了保护自己的领地而修建城墙。

sentences.english: Ying State was a feudal princedom in Central Plains in the Western Zhou period.
sentences.chinese: 应国是我国西周时期中原地区的一个小诸侯国。

sentences.english: From a vassal small to independent fiefdoms, qin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 从一个附庸小国到独立的诸侯国，秦。

definition: feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
vassal state
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
to divide and confer (property on one's descendants)

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Seven Powerful States of the Warring States, namely: 齊|齐[Qi2], 楚[Chu3], 燕[Yan1], 韓|韩[Han2], 趙|赵[Zhao4], 魏[Wei4] and 秦[Qin2]
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
country/state
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
